Technical director of Platform Engineering overseeing internal the build and operations of the GoDaddy Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) efforts.

Development, Evangelism and Evolution of Enterprise Standards, Enterprise Architectural Guidance and Maturity, Technical Leader in Networking, Security, Application and Systems Development, Data Architecture and Distributed Systems.

recommendations: April 18, 2010, Robert worked with Chris in different groups

I worked with Chris on quite a few occasions when he was the single man in charge of Go Daddy's early days of using MySQL.  It would be a discredit to Chris to say that he was always busy while managing the data stores for over half of our companies products (Email, hosting, and internal applications), but he always made time to offer me assistance in my young DBA days.  Chris always enjoyed a challenge and I always seemed to find the uncommon situations that reinforced the fact that he was an amazing engineer.  And as a result, set the bar for me to shoot for well beyond what the majority of professionals would consider exceptional.  Both a blessing and a curse it appears.I wish the best to Chris and any organization should be honored to consider Chris for any endeavor they may have a need for.

summary: Technology generalist with strengths in Distributed Systems Architecture, Data Architecture, Information Security, Enterprise Architecture, Network and Application Performance.  Strong background in full stack software and systems development for Linux and Windows based platforms.  Experience serving as a Development manager, Project Manager and Technical Leader for a rapidly growing organization.  Several years experience in Mergers and Acquisitions, Large Scale System Integrations and maturing Enterprise Standards in a highly evolving platform.
